document.docAuthor: Golovatch, Sergei, Evsyukov, Aleksandr & Reip, Hans
document.masterDocTitle: The millipede family Polydesmidae in the Caucasus (Diplopoda: Polydesmida)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The millipede family Polydesmidae in the Caucasus (Diplopoda: Polydesmida)

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5. Polydesmus
mediterraneus Daday, 1889
: A: male from Gurzuf, Crimea, habitus, dorsal view. B–C: male from Yashtukha, Abkhazia, leg 7, lateral view, and left gonopod, mesal view, respectively. Designations: en , endomere, ex, exomere. Picture A by K. Makarov. Scale bars: 0.2 mm (B), 0.1 mm (C), not to scale (A).

subSubSection.paragraph:

and

Quercus , Carpinus , Acer
etc. forest, litter and under bark,
21 – 22.IV.1987
, all leg. S. Golovatch and K. Eskov; 8 males, 4 females (ZMUM), Laza near Kussary, 10.VIII.1985 , leg. H. Aliev.

Descriptive notes. Adult body with 19 segments (collum plus 16 podous plus one apodous body rings, plus telson). Length ca
10 – 13 mm
, width of midbody metazonae 1.0 – 1.5 (male, female), metazonite to prozonite width ratio <1.8 ( Fig. 6 ). Live coloration usually uniformly yellowish to brown, about same in alcohol ( Fig. 6 ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 6. Habitus of
Brachydesmus assimilis Lohmander, 1936
. A: male from Belakany, Azerbaijan. B–H: male (B), female (C – E) and male (F – H) from Upper Gunib, Dagestan, Russia. C, F: anterior part of body. D, G: right half of segment 10. E, H: caudal part of body. Pictures A and B by K. Makarov, taken not to scale. Line drawings C – H by S. Dashdamirov, scale bar: 1.0 mm.

FIGURE 7. Gonopods of
Brachydesmus assimilis Lohmander, 1936
. A–B: male from Mariamdjvari Nature Reserve, Georgia, lateral and mesal views, respectively. C: male from near Pass Krestovyi, Georgia. D: male syntype from Tbilisi, Georgia (after Lohmander 1936). Designations: en, endomere; ex, exomere; s, spine on exomere; t, tooth near base of exomere; k, spine at base of endomere; b, tooth at base of femorite. Scale bar: 0.1 mm (A – C), not to scale (D).

subSubSection.paragraph: Remark. This species shows some variation not only in body size and in the shape of paraterga, but also in gonopod structure ( Fig. 7 ).
